sentence.Network_en: I checked the odometer . He was right. Four miles exactly. I could have sworn it was 20.
sentence.Network_cn: 我看了一下里程计, 他说得没错,确实是4英里, 我还坚信是20英里呢.

sentence.Network_en: The odometer is mechanical, driven by a stepper motor.
sentence.Network_cn: 里程表为机械式, 由一个步进马达带动.

sentence.Network_en: We found powdered sugar on the odometer cable.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们在里程表的电线上找到糖粉.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 18th cent.: from French odomètre, from Greek hodos 'way' + -meter

entry.def: An odometer is a device in a vehicle which shows how far the vehicle has travelled.

means.word_mean: 1. a meter that shows mileage traversed
